articles.title: Monkeypox: Man from Argentina Who Returned from Spain is First Confirmed Case in Latin America
articles.description: An official statement said health workers were treating the patient's symptoms, while his close contacts, who are asymptomatic, are being monitored
articles.content:
Argentina said Friday it has Latin America’s first known case of monkeypox. Local press reports said the patient was a 40-year-old man who recently returned from Spain, where two days ago the government reported 59 cases.
“The PCR test result… for th... [1279 chars]

articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — Argentina reported Latin America's first confirmed case of the monkeypox virus on Friday in a man who recently traveled to Spain.

articles.title: Argentina reports case of monkeypox; man traveled from Spain
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — Argentina reported Latin America's first confirmed case of the monkeypox virus on Friday in a man who recently traveled to Spain. The man, who is from the province of Buenos Aires, has monkeypox but health authorities are waiting to finish sequencing the virus before making the official announcement, said an official in Argentina’s Health Ministry.

articles.title: Flying museum to honor Diego Maradona ahead of World Cup
articles.description: The “Tango D10S” plane was introduced Wednesday night before it flies around Argentina for fans of Maradona to visit on the ground.
articles.content:
A flying museum in honor of soccer great Diego Maradona is set to take to the skies.
The “Tango D10S” plane was introduced Wednesday night before it flies around Argentina for fans of Maradona to visit on the ground.
